column4: Hey guys, wondering if someone can help...  I just tried compiling some java and it told me that it couldnt resolve a symbol, that symbol being java.io haha, if anyone knows anything please help
jsdk or with gcj
well then set them properly in your bashrc or bash_profile
I think I have, thats where the problem arises :P
using jsdk?
using the JDK yessir, possibly blackdown
which I believe is SUNs modified slightly
well if the env vars are set correctly i do not know what the problem can be :(
thanks for trying anyway :)
which file do you edit to alter your path ?
export PATH=$PATH:/new/dir
whenever I try that it doenst hold after I reboot or log out or close the console
to create the JAVA_HOME variable I had to edit bash.bashrc
, do the same for the path var, put the export in bashrc
I wasnt sure if it was okay to do that without it affecting other places that contrain the PATH variable, like profile
no problem in doing this
if this works ill give you your very own megabyte of space on my computer
ill call it USULSPACE
do i need to reboot to affect the changes?
you are welcome. nice to get a whole MB for my own... ;)
no just reopen the terminal emulator
